entry.title: Finally, a sane blogging platform
entry.content:
For awhile now, I've been meaning to start up a blog again to share thoughts on my studies and the exciting things happening in in the social sciences (and my particular discipline of sociology). I blogged a bit after college, but I find sites like Blogger and Wordpress restrictive.

Today, spurred on by the release of some cool data, I decided to look for a blogging platform. With a little help from github.io, Poole and a great tutorial from Joshua Lande, I've finally found a platform that does what I want it to do.

  1. Beautiful code. Both inline and with Gists.
  2. Minimal design. It's a blog, not a sales pitch. Content should be front and center.
  3. Responsive design. I want code to show correctly up on my smartphone.
  4. Openness. If someone likes the design, they can just hop over to the GitHub repo to see exactly how this blog is set up.

Hopefully, I'll be able to keep up with this throughout the year. Social science is only getting more exciting--with some controversy--as we see large internet-mediated natural experiments. So, by impliciation, it should also be a fun time to discuss these developments. And the web is a great place to put your thoughts out there... right?
